group_1.narration: The subject at hand was brought in@by Professor Satomi's friend, Kayano...
As we spoke, the Professor and I began@to refer to it as "the ghost story debacle."

group_1.textRight: ...Concerning the traditional youkai folktales@that are behind the current commotion...
It's true that stories like that have been passed@down in Kayano's area of Aobino.
...Well, I suppose it would be more accurate to@say that they're still being passed down, but...

group_1.textLeft: So where do we go from here?

group_1.textRight: It doesn't seem like most of these stories have@been documented in the first place...
The majority of them have only been passed@down orally.
But from Kayano's parents' generation onward,@fewer people have kept the tradition alive...
These days, only a handful of old-timers are@familiar with it.

group_1.textLeft: Hmm... But if that's the case, why is this@happening now...?

group_1.textRight: It sounds like a different story is the one that's@been going around.
Currently, the most talked-about ghost story@in Aobino is...

group_1.narration: "Strangers who come to Aobino will@be tricked by something not of this world@and vanish like a puff of smoke."

group_1.textRight: Something along those lines, anyway...
Kayano asked an old man who knows a lot@about traditional ghost legends,
but he said he's never heard of this one before.

group_1.textLeft: In other words...maybe it's like a game@of telephone?

group_1.textRight: That's what I think...
Somebody picked up a ghost story from@somewhere and circulated it online...
And then it got progressively altered until it@lost its original form...
That's just a guess on my end, but there's a@non-zero chance that it's true...
Plus there actually have been missing person@cases in Aobino.
That fact seems to have spurred@the rumours on.

group_1.textCenter: (80,000 people go missing in Japan@every year.)
(I can't imagine that all of those cases are@caused by some mysterious phenomenon.)
(I can't rule it out entirely, either...)
(After all, there are Witches in this world...)

group_1.textLeft: Would you like me to investigate?

group_1.textRight: Come again?!
Investigate, huh... I was simply going to look@for clues to dispel the hearsay...

group_1.textLeft: I want to get out there and find out the truth@behind the rumours.
If it really is just a myth that's been circulating,
and we can spread the word about that, I think@it'll put an end to the ghost story debacle.
Doing these kinds of interviews would be a@great experience for me.
So I was hoping you'd let me take care of it...

group_1.textRight: ...Do you have another goal in mind?
...For example...
The possibility that there might be...a Witch@behind these missing persons cases?
And where there are Witches...there will be@Magical Girls.
Which is why you want to cover it...
...Seems I've hit the nail on the head.

group_1.textLeft: ...But for those of us who know about Witches,@it's a very real possibility...!

group_1.textRight: ...It is. I completely overlooked that factor.
I suppose that would rule out my involvement@out of the picture...
...There is still a chance that Witches have@nothing to do with this, however...
So I'm going to look into it first.
It was truly careless of me to bring this up@with you...
I'm the one whom the case was brought to,@so it's my responsibility to begin with...!

group_1.textLeft: No, that's too dangerous...!@I'm the Magical Girl here!

group_1.textRight: You two are awfully lively.@What are you talking about?

group_1.textLeft: What sort of place is Aobino like, anyway?

group_1.textRight: It's a land of nature, nestled between the@mountains and the sea.
We're not coming here to have fun, so I didn't@pack our swimsuits.

group_1.textLeft: No, I guess this is how it has to be...

group_1.narration: Nayuta overheard the conversation that the@Professor and I were having, and suggested,@"Well then, let's all go together!"
He was hesitant to put her in harm's way,@but he relented to her persistence in the end.
I had no strong objections myself,@so I agreed to let Nayuta come with us.
As well as one other person...

group_1.textRight: Hm? Is something the matter?

group_1.narration: Upon hearing what Nayuta said,@Rabi decided to accompany us@without a second thought...

group_1.textCenter: (I'm tagging along with the Professor's family@on their summer vacation...)
(...W-well, anyway! The important thing is@our investigation...!)
(If there are footprints of Magical Girls@in Aobino...)
(Then I must make a record of them!)
